result.execSummary:
The defendant Alberto Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any previously imposed sentences

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
++   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not have contact with victim.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 2yrs WSP consecutive to any previously imposed sentences; initial confinement of 1-1/2yrs followed by 6mos of ES.  See ES conditions.  DNA ordered; written notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  Defense counsel requests credit for 10 days - since this is a consecutive sentence, credit will not be applied unless not applied on other sentences.  Defense counsel to investigate whether the deft is entitled to this credit.  Per Court - deft not entitled to CIP or SAP - clerk questioned court after hrg was concluded

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Atty Michael Barth appeared on behalf of the deft.  Deft not produced from Oshkosh Corr.  Sentencing set over to 1/9/17 @ 11am.

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Atty Michael Barth appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not produced from Oshkosh Corr.  Sentencing hrg adj to 11/15/16 @ 10am
Blank Verdict Forms
Jury find the deft - Guilty of Disorderly Conduct.
email sent to Agent Katie Brasure requesting an update
DRAFT NO. 1
Preliminary
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth.  Deft stipulates to the repeater enhancement.  Voir dire commences @ 10:15am.  Jury selected @ 11:27am.  Unselected jurors released for the day @ 11:28am.  Selected jurors released @ 11:40am; instructed to return @ 12:45pm.  Jurors reconvene @ 12:53pm.  Jurors sworn.  Preliminary instructions given to the jurors.  Opening statements given.  Testimony commences - Dean S., Alyssa W., & Shawn C.  State rests @ 2:16pm.  Court takes a short break; jurors excused from courtroom.  Deft elects not to testify.  Deft briefly questioned by the Court regarding his decision not to testify.  Jurors reconvene @ 2:39pm.  Defense rests @ 2:40pm.  No rebuttal.  Final instructions given to the jury.  Closing arguments.  Jurors commence deliberations @ 3:20pm.  Verdict reached @ 3:36pm.  Jurors reconvene @ 3:50pm.  Deft found guilty.  Jurors polled.  State moves for judgment on the verdict.  Defense moves for judgment notwithstanding the verdict.  State's motion granted.  Defense motion is denied.  Parties previously stipulated to the repeater enhancer.  Sentencing set for 10/24/16 @ 2pm.  Court wants an update from deft's probation agent.  Court also wants to review the deft's PSI from 2011.

15CF840 - case set for trial on 1/9/17 @ 9am.  Speedy trial demand filed.  NOTE - deft is in prison until July of 2017. 
15CM1115 - set for status on 1/9/17 @ 9am along w/CF file.

Minutes:  15CF840/15CM419/15CM1115.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth.  Cases are not resolved.  Court commences ludwig hrg; hrg interrupted.  Deft would like add'l time to speak w/his atty.  Parties to notify the court by 5pm on 9/7/16 if the cases are resolved.  No plea bargaining after that date.
Jury selection on September 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on August 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
